response:
Subacute brainstem syndrome with ophthalmoplegia, ataxia and hyperreflexia prioritises autoimmune/inflammatory aetiologies; vascular and infectious causes remain important exclusions. Distal sensory loss suggests a coexistent axonal neuropathy.

differential_diagnosis = ["Bickerstaff brainstem encephalitis (anti-GQ1b syndrome)", "Multiple sclerosis", "Wernicke encephalopathy", "Listeria rhombencephalitis", "Midbrain stroke (ischaemic or cavernoma haemorrhage)", "Brainstem glioma", "Chronic progressive external ophthalmoplegia (mitochondrial)", "Length-dependent axonal polyneuropathy (diabetes or vitamin B12 deficiency)"]
